New Records: Detroit Tigers handed their worst shutout loss since Game 1 of the 1945 World Series.
Key Match Events: Tyler Holton failed to record an out and reliever Reese Olson gave up a three-run homer to Lane Thomas in the first inning.
Josh Naylor hit an RBI single to chase Tyler Holton.
Reese Olson made a mistake with a pitch right down the middle to Lane Thomas, who belted it into the left-field bleachers.
Detroit hitters struck out 13 times, and the Tigers didn’t get a runner past first over the final five innings.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager A.J. Hinch’s decision to not use a traditional starter in Game 1 of the AL Division Series backfired.
The Tigers came in feeling confident after going 31-13 since Aug. 11 to earn a postseason berth before sweeping AL West champion Houston in the wild-card round.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager A.J. Hinch commented on the difficulty of overcoming a five-run deficit in the first inning.
Zach McKinstry blamed himself and the grounds crew for the fielding error that led to the first run.
Parker Meadows emphasized the need to keep playing their game and expressed confidence in Tarik Skubal for Game 2.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers have Tarik Skubal on deck, who led the AL in wins, ERA, and strikeouts, and will start Game 2 on Monday.
